txt.en: 'Fram then took the dragon's-tooth necklace for himself, and set about ordering the lands of his people.\n\n'Did the necklace hasten Frumgar's illness? I can not say for certain. I am certain, however, that Fram's heart only held admiration for his father. There was never an ill wish between the two while their lives overlapped.'
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Fram's Return
'On the first day of spring in the year two-thousand, Fram returned. He emerged from the woods bedraggled and dirty, yet unharmed.\n\n'Let us learn what we can of Fram's return from parts unknown.'
'With him Fram bore two great sacks, which he poured out amid the rubble of his father's hall.'
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should locate ancient adornments inside the keep at Framsburg.
Léothred can be found at Framsburg.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Framsburg.
'Let us learn what we can of Fram's return.'
Talk to Léothred near the keep at Framsburg
'Fram then took the dragon’s-tooth necklace for himself, and set about ordering the lands of his people.'
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Continue learning the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
'One was filled with treasures, gold and silver and jewels of dwarf-make.'
'These are but a small portion of Scatha’s hoard.'
Talk to Léothred elsewhere at Framsburg
'The second bag contained with huge teeth, prized from the dragon’s skull.'
'Frumgar's illness only worsened, and he died of it a few years later.'
Talk to Léothred at Framsburg
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Talk to Léothred elsewhere at Framsburg
Locate ancient adornments at Framsburg ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Léothred can be found at Framsburg.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Framsburg.

'Yes, it is interesting that all of the adornments you have found are dwarf-made. This is no coincidence, and I will explain why soon enough.\n\n'What I must tell you first is what Fram did with Scatha's bones. He made for his father a necklace of the dragon's teeth. When Frumgar received the gift, he was glad to be thus avenged. His happiness was to be short lived, however.'
Talk to Léothred near the keep at Framsburg
Léothred, the Rohirric scholar, wishes to learn more about Fram's history and the decisions that he made in life.

'Fram’s people hailed him as a hero, and at his bidding Fasthálla was rebuilt in a manner grander than what came before. The Ai-thúda named it Framabárg in his honour. The treasures of Scatha's hoard adorned it.\n\n'Could it be that some of Scatha's hoard still adorns the ruins of the keep? We should search the ruins for any signs of Scatha's treasures.'
